DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the adverse event alternate etiology.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Available in place of something else._The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Available in place of something else.:The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

Concepts.definition: Available in place of something else.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Available in place of something else._The cause of a disease or abnormal condition._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pre-existing Disease or Disorder Or Preexisting Condition Other

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pre-existing Disease or Disorder Or Preexisting Condition Other
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been present before a specific date or event.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Having been present before a specific date or event.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unforeseen and unplanned event or circumstance frequently causing loss or injury.: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: Anything that contributes causally to a result.

Concepts.definition: An unforeseen and unplanned event or circumstance frequently causing loss or injury.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.: A state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.
A state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
